edu.washington.cs.touchfreelibrary.touchemulation
Class GestureCursorController

java.lang.Object
  edu.washington.cs.touchfreelibrary.touchemulation.GestureCursorController
All Implemented Interfaces:
CameraGestureSensor.Listener, ClickSensor.Listener
public class GestureCursorController
extends java.lang.Object
implements CameraGestureSensor.Listener, ClickSensor.Listener

Class GestureCursorController can be used to create the visual and functionality of a cursor that is controlled via gestures. To use this class, one must create a CameraGestureSensor object and a ClickSensor object and set this as a listener to both.

For an object of this class to be functional, the view returned by getView() must attached to a parent object and drawn on the screen somewhere. You can use attachToActivity(Activity) to easily attach this to an Activity. Clicks will be registered to whatever is below the view.

Author:
Leeran Raphaely

Method Detail

start

public void start()
Starts this instance of GestureCursorController, meaning the cursor will be drawn onto the view, and clicks will be sent to the application below.

stop

public void stop()
Stops the instance from acting as a cursor, which will no longer be drawn on the view.

setDisableInjection

public void setDisableInjection(boolean disableInjection)
Sets whether or not injection will be disabled.

Parameters:
disableInjection - if true, injection will not occur. If false, it will occur as per usual.

setStopClickSensor

public void setStopClickSensor(ClickSensor stopSensor)
Assign one click sensor to set the cursor's velocity to 0 as opposed to actually triggering a tap.

Parameters:
stopSensor - The click sensor that will cause the cursor to stop. This can be set to null if no stop click sensor is wanted.
